column4: Sotheby's nicks CEO from Madison Square Garden
column5: Auction house Sotheby's appointed Madison Square Garden Co Chief Executive Tad Smith its CEO  a surprise development that could delay the plans of the owner of the New York Knicks to spin off its live entertainment business.

column4: UPDATE 3-Sotheby's nicks CEO from Madison Square Garden
column5: March 16 Auction house Sotheby's  appointed Madison Square Garden Co Chief Executive Tad Smith its CEO  a surprise development that could delay the plans of the owner of the New York Knicks to spin off its live entertainment business.

column4: Sotheby's names Madison Square's Tad Smith as CEO
column5: March 16 Auction house Sotheby's  appointed Madison Square Garden Co Chief Executive Tad Smith its CEO  replacing William Ruprecht.

column4: Blackstone to buy former Sears Tower in Chicago for $1.3 billion
column5: NEW YORK The Blackstone Group LP agreed on Monday to buy the Willis Tower  the former Sears Tower that for 25 years was the world's largest building  in a deal that features an observation deck as a tourist attraction and unique revenue stream.

column4: UPDATE 1-Blackstone to buy former Sears Tower in Chicago for $1.3 bln
column5: NEW YORK  March 16 The Blackstone Group LP  agreed on Monday to buy the Willis Tower  the former Sears Tower that for 25 years was the world's largest building  in a deal that features an observation deck as a tourist attraction and unique revenue stream.

column4: Blackstone to buy former Sears Tower in Chicago for $1.3 bln

column4: Valeant trumps Endo with $10.96 billion bid for Salix Pharma
column5: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  increased its takeover offer for Salix Pharmaceuticals Inc  to $10.96 billion in cash on Monday  eliminating Endo International Plc   the only other bidder for the maker of gastrointestinal drugs.

column4: UPDATE 4-Valeant trumps Endo with $10.96 billion bid for Salix Pharma
column5: March 16 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  increased its takeover offer for Salix Pharmaceuticals Inc to $10.96 billion in cash on Monday  eliminating Endo International Plc  the only other bidder for the maker of gastrointestinal drugs.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX climbs on upbeat sentiment ahead of Fed meeting
column5: TORONTO  March 16 Canada's main stock index rose on Monday as most major sectors benefited from bullish global equity market sentiment ahead of a crucial U.S. Federal Reserve policy meeting later this week.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX ends higher on Valeant  brighter sentiment
column5: TORONTO  March 16 Canada's main stock index rose on Monday as most major sectors benefited from bullish global equity market sentiment  while a gain in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc provided further support.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Valeant helps push TSX higher despite drop in oil shares
column5: TORONTO  March 16 Canada's main stock index jumped on Monday as a gain in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc helped overcome a drop in oil and gas shares spurred by lower crude prices.

column4: Endo withdraws offer for Salix
column5: Endo International Plc  said it would withdraw its cash-and-stock offer to acquire Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd  after Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  increased its bid for the bowel drug maker.

column4: Endo withdraws offer for Salix
column5: March 16 Endo International Plc said it would withdraw its cash-and-stock offer to acquire Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd after Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc increased its bid for the bowel drug maker.

column4: Valeant raises offer for Salix Pharma to $173 per share
column5: March 16 Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc said it increased its offer for Salix Pharmaceuticals Inc to $173 per share  hoping to end a bidding war with Endo International Plc for the bowel drug maker.

column4: Rand Paul woos donors and hackers at tech conference
column5: AUSTIN  Tx.  March 16 As his likely rivals spent the weekend shaking hands in New Hampshire  potential Republican candidate Rand Paul flew to Texas to court the software developers and entrepreneurs who are likely to play a central role in the 2016 election.

column4: UPDATE 1-Visteon CEO to step down by year end  search for successor begun
column5: DETROIT  March 16 Auto parts supplier Visteon Corp said on Monday Chief Executive Tim Leuliette will step down as head of the company by the end of this year as soon as a successor is named.
